## plotly creates interactive graphs and tables

First, attach packages
```{r, include = FALSE}

library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(DT)
library(janitor)

```


Make an interactive graph of the iris data

```{r}

clean_iris <- iris %>% 
  clean_names()


iris_graph <- ggplot(data = clean_iris, 
                     aes(x = petal_width, 
                         y = petal_length)) +
  geom_point(aes(size = sepal_width, 
                 color = species),
             alpha = 0.6) +
  labs(x = "Petal width (cm)",
       y = "Petal length (cm)",
       title = "Iris metrics") +
  theme_minimal()

iris_graph

ggplotly(iris_graph)


```
